snippet.title: Hamptons-style home a potential record breaker - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
, could break the suburb house price record.
THIS Hamptons-style residence will easily become St Kilda's most expensive house if it sells near its price estimate of $8 million, CoreLogic records indicate. The benchmark currently belongs to , which achieved $5.4 million in October. RELATED:
The pool certainly makes a splash.
Elegant design is a feature of the property.
"It's a typical Brighton and Toorak home plonked in the heart of St Kilda," Whitefox director Marty Fox said of the six-bedroom epic. "And it's set on one of the largest blocks in St Kilda."
The property's lofty price hopes would see it smash the record.
Inside 33 Crimea St.
The house at shares the 819sq m landholding with a 40sq m pool, pool house, mini basketball court and manicured gardens. It's less than 10 years old and sprawls across three levels connected by a lift.
33 Crimea St.
Its mansion-like floorplan has a large open-plan living and dining area with a gas open-fireplace and a kitchen featuring waterfall marble benches, integrated appliances and a commercial-grade oven and cooktop. There's also a wine cellar, gym and eight-car basement garage with a turntable.
